content: What actually is the role of T-libs vs. libs-impl now -- is this written up somewhere?

And related to this, I've been getting chosen as a reviewer more often lately for these kind of changes, but is it actually kosher for me to approve such PRs? Not adding/changing stable APIs, just implementation details.
(I'd be interested in formally joining a team for that role, if possible)
I think there was a T-compiler meeting about all of this
I know it because I missed it :D
@cuviper I believe the compiler team is now responsible for the actual stdlib implementation, with libs focusing on the design.

@cuviper yeah, generally speaking it is kosher imo (though it's a bit in flux right now)

of course if you're ever uncertain feel free to cc libs or compiler team (depending on whether it's about internals or api concerns)
I guess I'll hear about it if I overstep

XAMPPRocky said:

cuviper I believe the compiler team is now responsible for the actual stdlib implementation, with libs focusing on the design.

so that has been decided? Shouldn't there be some kind of announcement or so?^^
I know this was being discussed but I didn't know it was already done.
yeah maybe we need an inside-rust blog post or something
